answers.answer: The sodium and cloride dont seem to be horribly out of whack, but the bilirubin and platelets are concerns, depending on what your health status is (any diabetes, kidney, liver disorders etc)  check this site for explanations of lab tests:http://www.janis7hepc.com/Labs.htmHope that is helpful!  OHC67
Are you on treatment for hepatitis c?
Butting in again, sorry mancona...Anybody heard anything about wheat grass juice helping wbc's?

I'm sorry everyone, I was so anxious to post I forgot to explain that these are my husbands test results and he is not on the treatment, but has had some problems with his kidneys recently, his doctor mentioned something about hepatorenal syndrom, so I was vry concerned when I saw the bun at 31 and his bili was 5.94Marie

I am not a doctor, but I believe this is all pretty normal while on treatment.  You will see your numbers fluctuate up and down from week to week.  Mostly down with the platelets, wbc and rbc.  Try not to worry too much.  If something was terribly wrong your doctor would contact you. (Hopefully).  When your chloride is above normal, it usually means you need to drink more water.  Platelets will drop just from being on the interferon, as well as the wbc.  The red blood count will drop from the copegus/ribavirin.  As for the BUN and sodium...not really sure why these would be elevated...Your doctor may do some kidney studies; or this may all be normal fluctuations..Good LuckJodi

I have a blood test result question also.  I just got back some results from just starting tx and I have a positive for Heb B Core, AB, Tot and repeatedly reactive for Hep C Virus, Ab.  The Hep C response was what I expected.  I was diagnosed with Hep in 1980.  Can you have Hep B & C?  Also has anyone else experienced low glucose with tx?Thanks for any help.  I went to Janis7hepc/lab to study other results but haven't found any explanation for the sugar and Hep B & C.  Maybe I just have low sugar and didn't know it...M

Yes, you can have more than one type of Hep at a time. Have you ever been vaccinated for Hep B? This can cause you to test + for antibodies (which is a desired result). You did not specify which Hep you tested positive for in '80. If it was HBV, and you cleared it, your test may just be reflecting that. You really need to discuss this with doc ASAP because HCV accompanied by another form can "wreak havoc" as my gastro put it.Hang in there Myrtles, we are going to make it through this.Love and Light,Moonbaby

Besides being about to have more than one type of hepatitis [such as a and b and c], you can also be infected with more than one genotype of hepatitis...Someone could potentially have hep B, hep C with genotypes 1a and 2b..

question: When should blood tests results be a warning for the doctor that something has gone terribly wrong. example if Sodium was 124 and 6 days later is 118, and chloride was 94 and then 87 6 days later, and Bun was 22 and then 31 6 days later, and plt  were 108 and then 89 6 days later. Should these results be sign that something is wrong?  Should there be cause for alarm ?If so what is recommended for the patient? and what does this mean.  I am very worried. Any input would be welcomeMarie
title: Blood test results  -warning signs
